title: Single of the Week: Bombay Bicycle Club – Ivy & Gold
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/07/bombay.jpg "bombay")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/1822-single-of-the-week-bombay-bicycle-club-ivy-gold/attachment/bombay)

**Bombay Bicycle Club**‘s second album is due for release on 12th July and if their first single, _Ivy & Gold_, is anything to go by it will sure to prove to any doubters why they won the Best New Band 2010 by NME over other nominees such as **Mumford and Sons** and **La Roux**. _Ivy & Gold_ opens up with melodic and superbly summery guitar plucking that would leave anybody whistling along to it for hours, as I am doing whilst writing this. This song will no doubt be a massive hit at festivals this summer- they are playing on the Red Bull Stage- and will no doubt be one of the highlights of any festival-goers weekend.

The lyrics themselves are beautifully crafted to show further why this song will become one of this summer’s biggest successes, with such a upbeat chorus ‘you’re a layer of my clothes made of ivy and gold’. The delicate guitars and drums compliment the lyrics massively, allowing the melody to take hold of the listener. After listening to _Ivy & Gold_, I believe the album, _Flaws_, will become an equally massive success especially after their festival appearances at T in the Park, Oxygen and Glastonbury festivals.

[Watch an acoustic performance of Ivy & Gold here](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WK2fWmsBUzk)

[Check out their Myspace](http://www.myspace.com/bombaybicycleclub)
